title: Kusaie (1902) Bible Portions
description:
Kusaie is spoken on Kusaie Island, the most easterly of the Carolines. It is a Micronesian language, as are all the languages of the Carolines, except Nukuoro.

1863 John; 1866 Matthew; 1868 Mark; 1869 Acts I—3John ABS, Honolulu; 1871 Luke; 1876 Ruth Philippians—2Thessalonians ABS, New York: Translated by B.G. Snow.; 1928 Bible Micronesian Mission, Kusaie: Translated by Elizabeth Baldwin, American Board of Commissioners for Foreign Missions.

language.name: Kosraean
language.area: Kusaie Island, Caroline Islands. Also in Nauru, United States.
